attributes.action: ban smoking in the Members Bar in the Houses of Parliament
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As of July 1, 2007, smoking will be banned in bars all over the UK - except for the Members Bar used by MPs which will be exempt!

The reason given for this legislation is to protect the health of bar staff, so are we to understand that the health of the bar staff in Parliament is less important than the desire for MPs to smoke? 

MPs should stop exempting themselves from laws they pass for everyone else to follow. If they don't think it right they shouldn't be allowed to smoke in their own bar, they shouldn't have passed a law preventing anyone else from doing so.
